reasonCode.text: Referred by orthodontist for full mouth rehabilitation due to anterior open bite, difficulty, and pain when chewing. Intraoral examination revealed hypomineralized AI and some hypoplasia.

code.text: Full mouth rehabilitation including composite veneer on incisors, composite full crowns on all other teeth, bonded using dual-cured composite resin.

note.text: Master impressions of the two arches were recorded. Patient monitored every 6 months. Direct composite applied 3 years later on the cervical part of the crown due to gingival maturation. Restorations remained satisfactory after five years.

code.text: Anterior open bite, difficulty and pain when chewing, hypomineralized AI, hypoplasia

resource.title: Discharge Plan
resource.description: Patient discharged with successful full mouth rehabilitation, no complaints of mastication issues. Educated on oral hygiene and instructed to follow up with regular dental check-ups and cleanings.
